intro: Mastigion appendiculatum, commonly known as the appendiculate mastigon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
